pullRequest.title: Use historic operations
pullRequest.bodyText:
The abort is based on historic operation event table since using flowable process context leads to locks on the same tables which the process uses and respectively to deadlocks.
LMCROSSITXSADEPLOY-2095

nodes.bodyText:
If this is only used in ProcessStepHelper, I don't think we need this extra class.
And, if it's only used to check about the ABORT_EXECUTED event type, I suggest changing this to
historicEventService.createQuery().processId(...).type(ABORT_EXECUTED).list()
and checking whether this list is empty.
This class already has 4 parameters, which is a bit much, and changing it to 5 isn't recommended.
Change it to use the concrete processId, not just any string
When having this many identical function calls, I suggest making a supplier of random uuids and calling its get() method
This test is identical to testGetAbortProcessAction. Either change or remove it
These 3 tests are really similar, so I suggest making them one ParameterizedTest

Why do you need these mock classes?
Isn't is possible with Mockito.spy(StartProcessAction.class)?
Why is the resume action called twice here?
Same comment as before. Use Supplier
We can use List.of(...) now that we have Java 11
